ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Recovering WPA/WPA2 passphrases by exploiting vulnerabilities in Wi-Fi Protected Setup (WPS) implementations.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Brute-force attack against Wifi Protected Setup (WPS) registrar PINs â€¢ Recovery of WPA/WPA2 passphrases â€¢ Offline Pixie Dust attack â€¢ Bug fixes and new features compared to original Reaver â€¢ Compatibility with various access points and WPS implementations
ðŸ“– Summary: The reaver-wps-fork-t6x repository is a community-maintained fork of the Reaver tool, designed for brute-forcing WPS PINs to recover WPA/WPA2 passphrases. It includes bug fixes, new features like the Pixie Dust attack, and aims to be a robust solution for testing the security of WPS implementations.
